title: Which book one must read to understand Chanakya? - Quora

response.answer_text: There is many books available which show the smartness and capability of Chanakya. Chanakya Arthashastra-Arthashastra is an ancient Indian treatise on statecraft, economic policy and military strategy, written in Sanskrit.  Chanakya neeti-One of tie best books-Chanakya Neeti is full of erudite thoughts of a great scholar, diplomat, strategist and teacher that serve as DOs and DONTs of the everyday life of any person who wants to make his life a grand success. The author, Acharya Chanakya (known as Kautilya or Vinshu Gupta) was bestowed with intelligence, creativity and statesmanship. He is the best administrator to be born till date. His hard labour, perseverance and guidance bore fruits to Chandra Gupta Maurya, the Emperor.  Chanakya chant Ashwin Sanghi who previously wrote Rozabal line. Author has mixed history with fiction. This novel goes back and forth between current India and India around 2000 years back when Chanakya was @live. And this happens among chapters while one chapter deals with current India next chapter deals with India 2000 years ago. Being a thriller every chapter ends on a high note but when you enter next chapter you are in different context altogether.

There are many books with the name “Chanakya” in their titles - Chanakya’s Chant, Inside Chanakya’s Mind (and others by Radhakrishnan Pillai ). Though these are good books, they are in no way related to Chanakya. So, these are the books that you should skip. Now coming to the books to read, start with “Arthashastra” (Published by Penguin. I have read this so I know that it is good). You can also read “Age of the Nandas and Mauryas” by A. Nilakanta Sastri and “Chandragupta Maurya and His Times” by Radhakumud Mookerji. These are academic books and are only meant for serious readers and those interested in history. For children, I would suggest reading books published by Amar Chitra Katha on Chanakya.
